name: UpdateErrorTrackingRules
description:
Updates error tracking assignment rules for a project.

Use this tool to update the assignment rules for error tracking in a specific project environment. This helps in managing how errors are assigned within a project.

parameters.name: assignment_rule_id
parameters.description: A UUID string that identifies the error tracking assignment rule to update.

parameters.name: project_id
parameters.description: Project ID to access. Retrieve it via a call to /api/projects/.

value_schema.description: Project ID of the project you're trying to access. To find the ID of the project, make a call to /api/projects/.

parameters.name: environment_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the environment whose error tracking rules are being updated.

parameters.name: filter_criteria
parameters.description: Specifies the filter criteria for updating error tracking assignment rules. This should be a string detailing the conditions used to filter the errors.

parameters.name: assignee_identifier
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the person to whom errors will be assigned. This can be a user ID or username within the project.

parameters.name: update_order_key
parameters.description: The order key for arranging assignment rules in a specified sequence. Provide an integer value.

parameters.name: disable_error_data
parameters.description: Specify whether to disable error data for tracking rules. Accepts a string value indicating the disabled state.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the Datadog API.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: A UUID string identifying this error tracking assignment rule.

value_schema.description: A UUID string identifying this error tracking assignment rule.

parameters.name: project_id
parameters.description: Project ID of the project you're trying to access. To find the ID of the project, make a call to /api/projects/.

value_schema.description: Project ID of the project you're trying to access. To find the ID of the project, make a call to /api/projects/.
